RECORD.TEXT: 544677599 CTMC 176065 10/10/1991 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary Unsigned DIS Admission Date : 10/10/1991 Report Status : 10/11/1991 DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS : RECURRENT STAGE 1B CERVICAL CANCER . ASSOCIATED DIAGNOSES : BONE METASTASES . ANEMIA . PERINEAL RASH . OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES : 2) Blood transfusion . 4) Dermatology consultation . 5) Im Villtro University Medical Center Medical Oncology consultation . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : She was originally diagnosed with cervical cancer in May of l989 . She was staged as lB and pathology showed a small cell neuroendocrine tumor of the cervix . She underwent a radical hysterectomy . in December of l990 , she had a vaginal apex mass on examination . Cystoscopy and proctoscopy were negative . A CT , however , confirmed a large pelvic mass with bilateral hydronephrosis . Between March and May of l990 , she received two cycles of chemotherapy in two parts alternating Cisplatin and VP-l6 with Vincristine , Cytoxan , and Adriamycin . In June of l990 , she underwent radiation therapy and in July of l99l , a right ventriculogram showed an ejection fraction of 48% . Her chemotherapy was then changed to a single agent of Cytoxan . There was a bony metastasis . Orthopedic Surgeons did an open reduction and internal fixation of a lytic lesion involving the right femur . On July 30 through August 4 of l99l , she received her first cycle of Ifosfamide and Mesna . She had prolonged neutropenia and on August 28 , she was admitted with a headache . She had non-focal findings per the Neurology Service . On September 6 , she began the next cycle of second line chemotherapy consisting of Carboplatin , Ifosfamide , and Mesna . She also had complaint of a left perineal rash over the last two weeks . She was started on Zovirax on October 3 . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY : Radical hysterectomy in May of l989 , open reduction and internal fixation of femur in July of l99l , and examination under anesthesia , cystoscopy , and proctoscopy in December of l990 . PAST OBSTETRICAL HISTORY : Spontaneous vaginal delivery times three . CURRENT MEDICATIONS : Zovirax 200 mg five times daily , Methadone 50 mg t.i.d. , and Ativan p.r.n. Blood pressure was ll0/70 , heart rate 84 , and temperature 97.4 . HEENT : No thyromegaly . CHEST : Clear to auscultation . Regular rate and rhythm . there was no distinct costovertebral angle tenderness . ABDOMEN : Slightly distended . There was mild tenderness to palpation in the right mid lateral abdomen . There were no peritoneal signs and no guarding . There were normal bowel sounds . EXTREMITIES : Without edema . PELVIC : By Dr. Friednantflirt revealed regrowth of the pelvic tumor . There was a dry scaly rash with multiple small scabs on the left perineum and posterior thigh . LABORATORY EXAMINATION : Her hematocrit was 22.9 and platelets were l24 . HOSPITAL COURSE : The bone scan was performed which revealed multiple metastases to the spine , ribs , and skull . There was noted , however , to be new pain in the right shoulder and , in fact , there was a lytic lesion involving the right shoulder and femur . The Radiation Service was consulted and noted that past areas treated including her right femur , her thoracic spine , pelvis , and right posterior ribs had all responded to radiation therapy and agreed that treating the right shoulder humerus and the right hip which had not been previously treated was reasonable . Planning for further radiation therapy was arranged for next week by the Radiation Service . She was also seen by the Dermatology Service who examined the rash and felt it was most likely a contact dermatitis . She was given Synalar Cream and Eucerin Cream as a moisturizer . The patient also received a unit of donor direct blood . Due to Dr. Friednantflirt 's concern that the tumor was growing despite the available chemotherapeutic regimen , the Im Villtro University Medical Center Medical Oncology Service was consulted . However , they felt that at the Venbonlea Health , there were several possible options including a possible phase I trial regimen . On the evening of 12/26/06 , the patient was discharged home in stable condition . DISPOSITION : DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS : Methadone l5 mg p.o. t.i.d. , Synalar Cream b.i.d. , and Eucerin Cream .
